fact_check_explanation_title: Is the NHS Pay Review Body ‘independent’?
fact_check_explanation_summary: With many NHS workers on strike, some unions have challenged the independence of its pay review body. We take a look at the facts behind some of the main claims.

fact_check_explanation_title: Near-identical posts about a missing child called Tyler are fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: Several of the posts feature almost identical text, with the name of the child and the accompanying image changed.

fact_check_explanation_title: Study didn’t link children’s flu vaccine to strep A infections
fact_check_explanation_summary: A 2014 study has been widely shared as alleged proof nasal flu vaccines are linked to strep A infections.

fact_check_explanation_title: Police warn against interacting with posts about missing Surrey boy
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post about a supposedly missing child has been shared hundreds of times.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fake lost dog post uses old stock image
fact_check_explanation_summary: The picture was originally taken in the Philippines in 2016.

fact_check_explanation_title: Tampering with electricity meters to try and save on energy bills is illegal and dangerous
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post has suggested it’s possible to save on electricity bills by bypassing your meter with a piece of wire. This is illegal and can also be dangerous.

fact_check_explanation_title: Oxford traffic scheme won’t ‘confine’ residents to specific neighbourhoods
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some have claimed on social media that a controversial plan to reduce congestion in Oxford constitutes a “climate lockdown”.

fact_check_explanation_title: ‘Facts’ in a graphic about UK Muslims are mostly wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Facebook post makes a number of false claims about Muslim mayors, mosque numbers, Sharia councils and other information about Muslims in Britain.

fact_check_explanation_title: Appeals about injured and lost dogs are fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: Facebook posts from users claiming to have found a missing or injured dog are fake.

fact_check_explanation_title: Instagram post wrongly links nasal flu vaccines to strep A outbreak
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s no evidence that nasal flu vaccines are driving increased rates of strep A, and the timing of the outbreak doesn’t mean this is the case.

fact_check_explanation_title: Video does not show ‘immigrants’ catching seagulls to ‘feast’ on
fact_check_explanation_summary: It actually shows volunteers ‘ringing’ a bird for research purposes.

fact_check_explanation_title: Hoax posts about missing grandfather circulating on local Facebook groups
fact_check_explanation_summary: The posts, which claim to be from someone looking for their missing grandfather, feature an image of a man who passed away earlier this year.
